title: 'Worn out tyres to faded runway line': DGCA audit report finds aviation lapses
content: A DGCA audit of India's aviation sector has revealed safety lapses, including worn aircraft tires, recurring defects due to ineffective repairs, and faded runway markings. The surveillance also found issues with ground handling equipment, maintenance procedures, and vehicles lacking speed governors. The DGCA has directed concerned operators to take corrective actions within seven days to address these critical findings.

title: Truce violation: Trump says 'really unhappy with Israel, not happy with Iran either'
content: Donald Trump has criticized both Israel and Iran for allegedly violating the recent ceasefire agreement. He specifically disapproved of Israel's immediate response following the truce, referencing reported airstrikes after a missile launch from Iran. While acknowledging the violations, Trump remains uncertain if the ceasefire is entirely broken.

title: WATCH | 'Ek taraf se Mohammad, ek taraf se Krishna': Gill's rally cry
content: Shubman Gill motivated Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna on Day 5 of the first Test. England chased 371 runs, reaching 117 at lunch without losing a wicket. Gill's remark about the bowlers was caught on the stump mic. Teams observed silence for Dilip Doshi's passing. England needed 254 more runs with all wickets in hand to win the match.

title: New US Visa rule: Visa applicants to change this setting on FB, Instagram
content: The US embassy in India has announced that applicants for F, M, and J non-immigrant visas must now make their social media accounts public. This new guideline aims to help U.S. officials verify the identity and eligibility of visa applicants during the security screening process. The embassy stated this change is necessary to facilitate vetting and establish admissibility under U.S.

title: Air India to resume Middle East, Europe flights; US, Canada operations next
content: Air India announced the gradual resumption of flights to West Asia as airspace reopens in the conflict-hit region, with most Middle East operations restarting from June 25. Flights to and from Europe are being reinstated, while services to the US East Coast and Canada will resume soon. The airline is committed to minimising disruptions and avoiding unsafe airspaces.

title: Udaipur shocker: French tourist sexually assaulted; FIR filed, accused flees
content: In Udaipur's Tiger Hill area, a French tourist reported a sexual assault after visiting a local caf√©. Following a visit to The Greek Farm caf√©, the victim allegedly left with a man named Siddharth, who is accused of taking her to his room and committing the assault.

title: 'Virat Kohli felt it was time to go': Sourav Ganguly drops bombshell on his shocking Test retirement
content: Sourav Ganguly confirmed Virat Kohli's Test retirement was his own decision, despite BCCI's attempts to persuade him otherwise. Ganguly acknowledged Kohli's choice, drawing parallels to his own retirement, emphasizing that every player understands their standing. While surprised by Kohli's relatively early departure at 36, Ganguly believes Kohli felt it was the right time, similar to his own exit.

title: When Microsoft froze ICC lawyer‚Äôs email over Netanyahu warrant
content: Microsoft suspended ICC prosecutor Karim Khan's email after a Trump order, raising concerns in Europe about reliance on US tech. This action, following an ICC warrant for Netanyahu, highlighted America's tech dominance and sparked fears of geopolitical leverage. Europe is now pushing for tech independence, exploring alternatives and investing in homegrown infrastructure to reduce dependence on American giants.

title: 'They are not Bangladeshis': Mamata says Bengal migrants wrongfully held
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee claims Bengali workers are wrongly identified as Bangladeshis and deported. She accuses the BJP of language-based politics. Banerjee says her government has rescued some workers. Recent crackdowns in Delhi saw the arrest of suspected illegal immigrants. Banerjee previously accused the BSF of aiding infiltration.

title: Watch: Fire erupts in Moscow apartment after Ukrainian drone strike
content: A Ukrainian drone strike ignited a fire in a multi-storey building in Krasnogorsk, Moscow, injuring two and prompting the evacuation of over 100 residents, including 30 children. Russia's defence ministry reported destroying 20 Ukrainian drones across six regions, leading to temporary flight suspensions at Moscow's Vnukovo and Sheremetyevo airports.

title: Bold statement! 'Rishabh Pant could break Rahul Dravid's record'
content: Rishabh Pant's twin centuries in the Leeds Test have sparked discussions about his potential to surpass Rahul Dravid's record for most Test centuries by an Indian in England. Sanjay Manjrekar highlighted Pant's unique position as a wicketkeeper-batter, praising his adaptability and aggressive yet measured approach.

title: Elon Musk‚Äôs simple life: World‚Äôs richest says will never own 5 things
content: Elon Musk, despite his immense wealth, maintains a surprisingly minimalist lifestyle. He sold numerous properties, opting for a small Boxabl home and even crashing at friends' places. Musk once lived on $1 a day and famously crashed a McLaren, never replacing it, showcasing his detachment from luxury possessions and focus on his ventures.

title: 'Vote theft': Rahul Gandhi alleges voter list manipulation in Fadnavis' constituency
content: Rahul Gandhi has accused Devendra Fadnavis' constituency of voter list irregularities, alleging an eight per cent increase in five months and unauthorized voting. Gandhi shared a news article on X, calling for the release of digital voter rolls and CCTV footage. He claims the Election Commission is silent or complicit, labeling the situation as "vote theft".

title: Rashtrapati Bhavan: Siddaramaiah-Aamir Khan candid pics go viral
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Bollywood actor Aamir Khan exchanged warm greetings at Rashtrapati Bhavan on Tuesday, capturing the internet's attention. The spontaneous interaction was described as friendly, with both exchanging best wishes. Siddaramaiah is in Delhi for official engagements, including a meeting with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

title: Black box of crashed AI plane not sent abroad, says Naidu; currently with AIIB
content: Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu refuted media reports claiming the Air India Ahmedabad crash black box was sent abroad. He confirmed the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) is analyzing it in India. The London-bound Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner crashed on June 12, killing 241, and the government formed a panel to investigate the cause.

title: US strike on Iran: Mystery deepens over missing uranium stockpile; buried or moved?
content: Satellite images and Israeli intelligence suggest Iran moved near-weapons-grade uranium before US airstrikes on its nuclear facilities. The missing fuel, enough for multiple bombs, raises concerns despite claims of program obliteration. While the strikes caused significant damage, the location of the enriched uranium remains unknown, hindering diplomatic efforts and potentially delaying Iran's nuclear ambitions.

title: 'All polls held as per law': EC rebuts Rahul; LoP repeats 'voter theft' charge
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) refuted Rahul Gandhi's rigging allegations in the 2024 Maharashtra polls, asserting adherence to established electoral laws and processes. Despite ECI's clarification and invitation for further discussion, Gandhi persisted with his claims of irregularities, particularly highlighting significant voter list increases in certain constituencies and demanding the release of digital voter rolls and CCTV footage.

title: Dwyane Wade‚Äôs daughter steals spotlight dancing in white lehanga
content: A delightful Instagram video of Kaavia James, daughter of Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, has captured hearts globally. The six-year-old is seen joyfully dancing to the Bollywood hit ‚ÄúWhat Jhumka?‚Äù while dressed in a traditional white lehenga. The heartwarming clip, posted by her parents, celebrates cultural exploration and youthful exuberance.

title: ITR filing last date extended: Will penal interest be charged after July 31? What experts say
content: The ITR filing deadline for FY 2024-25 has been extended to September 15, 2025, potentially waiving penal interest under Section 234A if self-assessment tax is paid by the extended date. However, this extension does not affect penal interest applicability under Sections 234B and 234C for advance tax deficiencies, which remain in effect.

title: 'She‚Äôs heartbroken': Blake Lively breaks down as Taylor Swift cuts ties
content: The friendship between Blake Lively and Taylor Swift has ended. Sources say Lively is heartbroken after Swift cut ties. Legal issues involving Justin Baldoni's case add complexity. Lively must submit texts with Swift. Rumors suggest Lively tried to leverage her Swift connection. Travis Kelce supports Swift during this difficult time. Swift's upcoming album may reflect themes of betrayal.

title: TCS plans big Rs 4,500 crore push: New campuses, office spaces & more
content: Tata Consultancy Services is investing heavily in expansion. New campuses and office spaces are planned across India. Bengaluru, Kolkata, and Kochi are key locations. The company aims to boost delivery capacity. This move signals confidence in India's tech talent. TCS reported strong financial results for FY25. Headcount also increased with new hires and promotions.

title: Peace in Our Timeline? How Trump keeps declaring ceasefires ‚Äî and craving credit
content: Because in Trump‚Äôs world, peace isn‚Äôt negotiated‚Äîit‚Äôs declared. Ceasefires aren‚Äôt forged in backrooms or brokered by diplomats. They‚Äôre conjured on‚ÄãTruth Social and announced as if the world runs on vibes. It‚Äôs not diplomacy. It‚Äôs delusion dressed in digital drag.

title: Diplomatic deja vu: Trump pulls off an India-Pakistan on Israel-Iran; ceasefire 'in effect'
content: US President Donald Trump unilaterally declared a ceasefire between Israel and Iran, a move that surprised even his own administration and the involved nations. Trump claimed both countries sought his intervention for peace. He outlined a detailed ceasefire plan on social media, complete with a timeline, despite ongoing missile exchanges.

title: IND vs ENG: Why are India, England players wearing black armbands? Full details
content: Indian and England cricket players wore black armbands on Day 5 of the first Test at Headingley to pay tribute to Dilip Doshi, the former Indian spinner. Doshi, who passed away at the age of 77 in London due to a cardiac arrest, was remembered for his determination and contributions to Indian cricket despite playing alongside Bishan Singh Bedi.

title: 8-hour ordeal: Leaky Vande Bharat train roof leaves student drenched; staff say ‚Äòadjust kariye‚Äô
content: Darshil Mishra's Vande Bharat Express journey from Varanasi to Delhi turned disastrous when the train's roof leaked, drenching him and fellow passengers. The onboard staff's dismissive response and the TTE's absence compounded the issue, forcing passengers to endure a humid and uncomfortable ride. The incident, captured on video, sparked outrage online, prompting calls for accountability and improved maintenance.

title: ‚ÄòSitaare Zameen Par‚Äô collection: Aamir's movie nears Rs 70 cr; sees slight dip
content: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' experienced a strong opening weekend, exceeding expectations despite being a niche film. The movie witnessed substantial growth on Saturday and Sunday, but faced a significant drop on Monday and Tuesday. While performing well in multiplexes and certain territories, its fate hinges on maintaining momentum throughout the week, especially with the upcoming release of 'Maa'.

title: ‚ÄòLove triangle or money plot?': Raja's kin seeks narco test on Sonam, lover Raj; brother moves HC
content: Following the murder of Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi during his honeymoon in Meghalaya, his family intends to petition the Meghalaya High Court for narco-analysis tests on his wife, Sonam, and her alleged lover, Raj Kushwaha. The family hopes the tests will reveal the unclear motive behind the murder, suspecting financial gain beyond the alleged love triangle.

title: 'You have 12 hours to...': Did Israeli agents warn Iranian generals before strike?
content: Following Israeli airstrikes on Iranian nuclear and military sites, intelligence agents initiated a covert intimidation campaign targeting top Iranian officials. The operation, dubbed "Rising Lion," involved chilling phone calls threatening Iranian generals to defect or face death. This campaign aimed to destabilize Iran's command structure after the elimination of key leaders, creating fear among potential successors.

title: Watch: Chaos erupts at music festival in Paris after mysterious syringe attacks
content: French authorities arrested twelve individuals accused of syringe attacks at a nationwide music festival, with approximately 145 people reporting needle pricks across the country, including 13 in Paris. Investigations are underway to determine if the syringes contained date rape drugs.

title: Adani Group to put $15-20 bn across businesses over 5 years
content: Gautam Adani announced a $15-20 billion investment plan over the next five years, aiming to fuel the Adani Group's growth across its diverse infrastructure portfolio.

title: No Royal roles for Harry-Meghan Markle‚Äôs children, reveal Palace insiders
content: Prince William, the future King, reportedly intends to exclude Prince Harry's children, Archie and Lilibet, from formal royal duties, furthering the family rift. Sources indicate William is focused on a streamlined monarchy, leaving Archie and Lilibet as 'outcasts'.

title: Indian Railways hikes fares of trains; minor increase in ticket prices from July 1
content: Indian Railways is set to hike passenger train fares for the first time in several years. The minor increase in fares will be effective from July 1, 2025. Earlier this month, Indian Railways made a significant announcement requiring Aadhaar authentication for tatkal train ticket bookings.

title: Ram Kapoor excluded from the promotions of Mistry after inappropriate remarks: Report
content: During promotions for the show 'Mistry,' actor Ram Kapoor faced backlash for making sexually inappropriate and offensive remarks towards the crew, including comments about kissing a male executive, his mother, and a female crew member's outfit. Following complaints and corroboration, the actor was removed from further promotional activities, with Mona Singh conducting solo interviews.

title: 'Mahi bhaiya...': MS Dhoni playing with a former teammates' son - Watch
content: Former India cricketer Saurabh Tiwary shared a heartwarming video on Facebook featuring MS Dhoni playfully interacting with his son, Sourish, in a gym. Tiwary, who debuted for India under Dhoni in 2010, recently transitioned to administration, being elected as secretary and joint secretary of the Jharkhand State Cricket Association after retiring from professional cricket last year.

title: Gulf tensions: Multiple flights disrupted across India; airlines issue alert
content: Flight operations at Delhi's IGI Airport faced major disruptions with 48 cancellations, impacting Air India and IndiGo significantly. Airports across India, including Ahmedabad, Thiruvananthapuram, and Mangaluru, experienced delays due to airspace restrictions over Qatar and the Gulf region. Cochin and Lucknow airports issued advisories amid heightened Middle East tensions following Iran's missile strike on U.S. bases in Qatar and Iraq.

title: Stock market rally: Investors richer by Rs 5 lakh crore - top reasons
content: Stock market today: The Nifty 50 concluded at 25,044.35, increasing by 72.45 points or 0.29 per cent, retreating from its day's peak of 25,317.70. The 30-share Sensex, which had advanced 1,121.37 points or 1.36 per cent to 83,018.16 during trading, pared gains following reports of ceasefire complications.

title: Will PPF rate fall below 7%? Public Provident Fund rate could hit 50-year low
content: Will Public Provident Fund (PPF) rate fall below 7% for the first time in decades, influenced by the Gopinath Committee formula and fluctuating 10-year government bond yields? Despite the possibility of a rate cut, PPF remains an attractive investment due to its tax-free interest, especially compared to taxable bank deposits and capped Voluntary Provident Fund contributions.

title: IND vs ENG: Ashwin comments on Jaiswal's catching; wants Jadeja to step up
content: R. Ashwin defended Yashasvi Jaiswal's slip catching in England, citing the Dukes ball's difficulty and urging patience. He highlighted the ball's larger feel compared to SG and Kookaburra. Ashwin also suggested Indian pacers create rough patches for Ravindra Jadeja to exploit, drawing inspiration from how foreign teams aid their spinners. He emphasized the importance of spin for India's chances.

title: BJP alleges Rahul Gandhi on 'secret' foreign trip; Congress hits back
content: The Congress party defended Rahul Gandhi's trip to London for his niece's graduation after BJP's Amit Malviya criticized his frequent foreign travels and demanded transparency. Congress spokesperson Pawan Khera accused the PMO of dirty tricks, confirming Gandhi's attendance at Miraya Vadra's graduation.

title: FWICE calls for boycott of Diljit Dosanjh,'Sardaarji 3' makers; urge PM Modi for action
content: The Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) has strongly condemned Diljit Dosanjh and the makers of ‚ÄòSardaarji 3‚Äô for casting Pakistani actress Hania Aamir, alleging she is 'anti-India'. FWICE has appealed to PM Modi for immediate action, urging a ban on the film's release in India and demanding the revocation of the filmmakers' passports.

title: Raj dig uncovers 3,500-yr-old site: ASI traces riverbed; findings link it to Saraswati river
content: In the heart of Rajasthan's Deeg district, archaeologists from the ASI have stumbled upon an ancient palaeochannel that may connect to the legendary Saraswati river. Recent excavations in Bahaj village have revealed settlements dating back to 3500-1000 BC, showcasing relics from the Kushan, Magadha, and Sunga dynasties.

title: Iran-Israel conflict: Trump declares ceasefire 'now in effect'; warns against violations
content: Amidst the Iran-Israel conflict, Donald Trump declared a ceasefire, which Iran promptly denied. Despite the denial, Iran confirmed its military operations ceased at 4 am Tehran time, following missile strikes on a US base in Qatar in response to attacks on its nuclear facilities. Tensions remain high as Iran's Supreme Leader asserts the nation's resilience.

title: IND vs ENG: Pant reprimanded by ICC - why has he been punished?
content: Rishabh Pant has been reprimanded by the ICC for breaching the Code of Conduct during the Headingley Test against England. Pant showed dissent at an umpire's decision regarding the condition of the ball, leading to a demerit point on his record. Despite this incident, Pant had an outstanding batting performance, scoring two centuries in the match.

title: 'Molested & beat me': Woman groped, assaulted near Bengaluru
content: In Bengaluru's outskirts, a 26-year-old woman faced sexual harassment and assault by a group, leading to public outrage after videos surfaced. Police detained John Richard and his father, Kanikya Swamy, following complaints from both sides. The incident occurred when John, allegedly intoxicated, accosted the woman with lewd comments, escalating into a physical assault.

title: S&P raises India‚Äôs GDP growth forecast to 6.5%, despite fragile global situation
content: S&P Global Ratings anticipates India's economy will grow 6.5% this fiscal year. This revision considers normal monsoon and lower crude oil prices. Global uncertainties and Middle East unrest pose risks.

title: Gold rate today: Prices drop below Rs 97,000 per 10 grams- what‚Äôs the outlook?
content: Gold prices plummeted on MCX after a reported ceasefire announcement between Iran and Israel, with August futures dropping by approximately 3% to Rs 96,422/10 grams. Silver also declined, while both metals had previously gained due to Middle East tensions.

title: Qatar PM Hopes Israel Won't Exploit Iran Truce To Keep Bombing Gaza
content: Mediator Qatar's said Tuesday it was working on resuming Gaza ceasefire talks in days, urging Israel not to exploit a truce with Iran to "unleash everything it wants to unleash" on the blockaded strip.

title: Not Just B-2 And Tomahawk, US Secretly Deployed These 5 Weapons For Iran
content: Five weapons, apart from the Tomahawk cruise missiles and the GBU-57 bunker-buster bombs, no one knew about till now, were also deployed by the US for its mission to strike Iran's three nuclear sites - Fordow, Natanz and Eshafan.

title: Israel-Iran War LIVE Updates: Iran On Alert As Israel Vows To "Respond Forcefully" After New Attack
content: US-Israel-Iran Conflict LIVE Updates: A series of powerful explosions rocked Tehran early Tuesday morning, hours after US President Donald Trump announced that Iran and Israel have agreed to a staggered ceasefire.

title: "Unlimited Scope Of Abuse": Meitei, Thadou Tribe Bodies Ask Centre To Remove 'Any Kuki Tribes' From Manipur ST List
content: Two top civil society organisations of Manipur's Meitei community and the indigenous distinct tribe Thadou have asked the central government to remove 'Any Kuki Tribes' from the list of Scheduled Tribes (ST) in Manipur.

title: "All Planes Will Head Home": Trump, Unhappy With Israel, Dials Netanyahu
content: The ceasefire between Iran and Israel "is in effect" and Israel is not going to attack Iran, Donald Trump declared on Tuesday amid fears that the tenous ceasefire agreement between Iran and Israel will not hold.

title: Governments Should Take House Panels' Reports In Constructive Manner: Om Birla
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Tuesday said that governments should take the reports of parliamentary committees in a constructive manner and not as a criticism of their functioning.

title: 'Aggressor' To 'Peacemaker' In 2 Days: Trump And The Iran-Israel Thriller
content: Genius or Joker? Or the joker who changes fortunes in a card game. If the 12-day Israel-Iran conflict is a tale of surprises, its protagonist is none other than US President Donald Trump

title: Air India To Resume Flights To Middle East, Europe From Today
content: Air India, which halted its flights to several regions as Iran fired missiles at the United States' Al Udeid air base in Qatar on Monday, is resuming services to the Middle East and Europe starting Tuesday.

title: 3 Dead After Inhaling Poisonous Gas In Well In Madhya Pradesh's Guna
content: Three persons died due to suspected inhalation of poisonous gas in a well while trying to rescue a calf in Guna district of Madhya Pradesh on Tuesday, officials said.

title: Pics: Meet Andhra Woman Who Is Set To Go To Space In 2029
content: Jahnavi Dangeti, from Palakollu in West Godavari district, Andhra Pradesh, is set to travel to space in 2029 after she was selected as an Astronaut Candidate (ASCAN) for the prestigious Titans Space Astronaut Class of 2025.

title: Obsessive Love, VPNs, 1 Wrong Login: Woman Techie's Bizarre Bomb Hoax Saga
content: Truth is stranger than fiction, and reality more bizarre than crime shows. In a tale of spurned love sure to spawn an OTT series, a 30-year-old robotics engineer from Chennai set off alarm bells in 11 states by allegedly sending hoax bomb threats

title: Air India To Resume Flights To Middle East As Airspaces "Gradually" Reopen
content: Air India on Tuesday said it will progressively resume flights to the Middle East as airspaces are gradually reopening in the region and most of the operations will resume from June 25.

title: "Wait For December": DK Shivakumar Loyalist Hints At Change Of Guard Again
content: The factionalism in Congress unit in Karnataka -- papered over when the party won the 2023 assembly elections -- appears to be developing cracks over a rumbling demand for a change of guard at the top.

title: Pregnant Woman, Her Father Killed In Collision With Car Driven By Drunk Driver
content: A family's moments of happiness turned into heartbreak when a head-on collision involving a drunk driver claimed the lives of a seven-months pregnant woman, her unborn baby and her father near Chennai early on Tuesday morning.

title: French Tourist Raped By Event Firm Employee In Udaipur
content: A French tourist has allegedly been raped by a member of an event management firm. After they had dinner as part of a larger group, the man offered to show the woman around Udaipur, but took her to his room instead.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Congress May Have Finally Solved Its Tharoor Dilemma In Kerala
content: With the Nilambur by-election in the bag, maybe the Congress can finally put the sordid Tharoor saga behind it and concentrate on the challenging panchayat and assembly elections looming ahead.

title: No Compromise On Safety: Aviation Minister On Char Dham Helicopter Crashes
content: In the wake of several helicopter accidents on Char Dham Yatra route this year, Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu asserted there should be no compromise on safety and said they are looking for innovative solutions for better safety measures.

title: "Have Shown No Hideout Is Safe For Terrorists": PM Modi On Operation Sindoor
content: Asserting that Operation Sindoor has made clear to the world India's stringent policy against terrorism, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Tuesday that his government takes whatever steps are appropriate in national interest.

title: "Hammered Her Face": Telangana Teen Gets Boyfriend To Kill Her Mother
content: A woman died late evening on Monday after she was allegedly strangled by her 16-year-old daughter and her boyfriend and his brother in Telangana, said the police.

title: Woman Labourer Finds 2.69 Carat Diamond In Panna After 2 Years Of Search
content: A middle-aged woman labourer, Savitri Bai Sisodia, found a 2.69-carat diamond while digging a mine in Panna district of Madhya Pradesh on Monday.

title: MMA World Power Index: Eight countries represented at UFC 317
content: MMA is a true example of an international sport . 10 countries are represented among the 17 divisional champions . 26 fighters from eight nations capping off the UFC's international Fight Week . the voting criteria were based on four factors: current champions, ranked fighters across all divisi .

title: Our early 2025-26 NBA Power Rankings: Stacking all 30 teams
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder are crowned the new champions of the league . the 2024-25 season has officially come to a close . our writers reflect on what to expect this offseason and put down the groundwork for what should be another competitive, unpredictable, 2025-26 season .

title: Which Finals stars made our top five?
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder have been crowned NBA champions for the first time since arriving in the Sooner State 17 years ago . the NHL handles its postseason honors that way, with the Conn Smythe Trophy awarded to the player with the best overall postseason . we set out to fill that gap with our five-player MVP ballot .

title: Fantasy: How Haliburton's injury impacts Pacers
content: the Pacers could see the biggest shift in fantasy value for 2025-26 . in eight games without Haliburton this past season, Nembhard averaged 11.3 points, 2.6 rebounds and 6.6 assists . his 28.9 minutes per game in 2024-25 was a career high for the third-year pro out of Gonzaga .

title: Why empty seats litter Club World Cup, Gold Cup
content: the club world cup is supposed to be the summer of soccer in the united states . the club is a warmup act for the 2026 FIFA World Cup in the u.s., canada and mexico . fans are struggling to back the tournament as attendances remain relatively low . three world cup hosts face off in their final competitive matches .

content: the celebrity rows at WNBA games have continued to pop off this season . on Juneteenth, the reigning national champion UConn Huskies women's basketball team made the trip down from Storrs to support former teammate Paige Bueckers .

title: Delap: Cole Palmer convinced me to join Chelsea
content: Cole Palmer helped convince him to join the club this summer . the 22-year-old attracted interest from a host of clubs including manchester united , Nottingham Forest and Newcastle . delap and Palmer played in the same youth team at Manchester City in 2020-21 .

content: the LSU Tigers beat Coastal Carolina with a big double play to take home the men's college world series . the title they really won was that of Greatest Ever College Baseball Program . "when we go to work every day, we do it trying to make the Tigers that came before us proud," says a designated hitter .

title: Jon Jones operated on his terms, even in announcing his retirement
content: david frum: the retirement news of arguably the greatest mixed martial artist of all time was underwhelming . he says he was let down by the man he recently called the best pound-for-pound fighter in the world . his retirement squashed a highly anticipated heavyweight title unification fight between Jones and iraq . frum says it's not the end of Jones' complicated career .

content: rookies across the league have had their chance to make their first impressions . there were 32 first-round picks from the 2025 draft . a group of rookie pass catchers came to the building at 5 a.m. .

title: Jones known for being great, not fighting Tom Aspinall
content: Dana White announces Jon Jones' retirement from the UFC . he declares Tom Aspinall the new heavyweight champion . "Jon Jones called us last night and retired," he tells a group of reporters . the 37-year-old has retired from mixed martial arts .

title: 2025 NBA Finals: OKC crowned champion in winner-take-all Game 7
content: Oklahoma City won the 2025 NBA Finals against the Pacers . it didn't matter that the league's Most Valuable Player, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, was living up to the award's billing . the Thunder won their 17th season in the Sooner State . he drove a 3-pointer at the top of the key .
